recommendations.title: Mona Lisa Overdrive
recommendations.author: William Gibson
recommendations.reason: You have read 'Neuromancer' and 'Count Zero,' which are the first two books in William Gibson's seminal Sprawl Trilogy. 'Mona Lisa Overdrive' is the third and final novel in this series, making it a natural and highly recommended next read to complete the story and further explore the universe you've already enjoyed.

recommendations.title: Snow Crash
recommendations.author: Neal Stephenson
recommendations.reason: As a fan of 'Neuromancer,' you'll appreciate 'Snow Crash' as another landmark work in the cyberpunk genre. It's known for its groundbreaking depiction of the metaverse, its unique blend of action and satire, and its complex world-building, offering a different but equally influential take on the cyberpunk aesthetic.

recommendations.title: Do Androids Dream of Electric Sheep?
recommendations.author: Philip K. Dick
recommendations.reason: Given your interest in 'Neuromancer' (a cornerstone of cyberpunk) and 'Solaris' (philosophical science fiction), this classic by Philip K. Dick offers a compelling blend of these elements. It explores profound themes of humanity, artificial intelligence, and the nature of reality, which are central to both the cyberpunk genre and the introspective feel of 'Solaris'.
